intro: Stephanophysum ventricosum, commonly known as the bladder wort, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its bladders, which are specialized structures used to trap small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes, where it can anchor itself to submerged surfaces. Its leaves are often green and arranged in whorls, while its flowers are small and usually pink or white. Stephanophysum ventricosum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms.
